result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Keen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:26 p.m. Defendant Adam J. Keen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by the defendant. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

10:43 am case called. Defendant Adam J. Keen in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant states he will proceed without counsel.  Court accepts waiver of counsel and admonishes defendant regarding trial and counsel. Court adresses motions in limine filed by the State. Defendant has no position regarding motions filed. Defendant makes a motion to dismiss based on . Court grants all motions in limine by State, except para. 8. Court addresses second 906.09-defendant wants information suppressed-court grants State's motion regarding previous convictions-answer is 24-Court admonishes defendant regarding testimony-if he were to testify. Court makes statement regarding jury selection-5 preemptive strikes to each party-23 in box-13 impaneled. Defendant questions Court regarding jury selection. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding substance. Court questions defendant regarding substance. Defendant stipulates to the substance and test of substance. Court accepts waiver. Court requires defendant to provide a witness list by January 15, 2016 to the DA and Court.
Witness statement filed by DE

9:54 am case called. Defendant Adam J. Keen in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes statement regarding preliminary hearing and defendant's right to counsel. Defendant still wishes to proceed without counsel. State calls Deputy Scott Eagan, witness sworn, testimony given. No questions by defendant. Exhibit #1 marked. Statement by Defendant regarding jurisdiction. Statement by Court regarding jurisdiction. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Defendant confirms receipt & objects to charges. Court reads charges to defendant. Defendant stands mute to the charges. Court enters a plea on Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. FPT & JT scheduled-NOH given.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:00 am.

8:50 am case called. Defendant Adam J. Keen in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Right to counsel addressed-defendant wishes to waive his right to counsel. Defendant requests matter be dismissed based on lack of jurisdiction. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Requested.  Preliminary Hearing discussed. Defendant again raises jurisdiction. Court schedules a preliminary hearing. PH Scheduled - NOH Given.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-03-2015 08:45 am

Case Called @ 2:15 PM: Defendant Adam J. Keen in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he intends to represent himself and requests adjourned IA.   Def just recently commenced new employment and requests adjournment.  The Court willing to grant request, however advises Def that some progress on procedures could be made today if willing.  AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Initial appearance at 10-06-2015 02:00 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Adam J. Keen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility will depend upon custody status.  ADA argues as to Signature Bond.  SPD concurs with bond recommnendation.   In light of release Def is advised that he will not qualify for SPD.  Def confirms he will proceed with retaining his own counsel.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
